body.name: HP DeskJet 2755e Wireless Color inkjet-printer, Print, scan, copy, Easy setup, Mobile printing, Best-for home, Instant Ink with HP+,white
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 23 hrs 53 mins
features: PERFECT FOR HOME – Best for printing basic color documents like recipes, forms and travel documents. Print speeds up to 7.5 pages per minute in black or 5.5 pages per minute in color..Operating temperature range : 41 to 104°F / 5 to 40°C
KEY FEATURES – Print, copy and scan in color, plus mobile and wireless printing

INCLUDES FREE HP+ SMART FEATURES – Upgrade free to HP+ during setup to get advanced features for mobile printing, security, automatic updates and more. HP+ only works with an HP account, internet connection and Original HP Ink for the life of the printer.
CONNECTIVITY – Dual-band Wi-Fi with self-reset automatically detects and resolves connectivity issues. Also includes USB 2.0 port.

HP SMART APP – Simple, step-by-step guided setup. Print, scan, and copy everyday documents from your phone—from anywhere. Get advanced features with HP+ in the Smart app including mobile fax and advanced scanning features such as multi-item recognition.

3 MONTHS OF INSTANT INK INCLUDED WITH HP+ – Print up to 700 pages a month and get ink delivered only when you need it. After 3 months, monthly fee applies unless cancelled, and you'll save up to 50% on ink.

This printer is intended to work only with cartridges with original HP chips or circuitry and will block cartridges using non-HP chips or circuitry. Periodic firmware updates will maintain the effectiveness of these measures. Operating humidity range 20 to 80% RH (non-condensing).

Dynamic security enabled printerCertain HP printers are intended to work only with cartridges that have a new or reused HP chip or electronic circuitry. These printers use dynamic security measures to block cartridges using a non-HP chip or electronic circuitry. Periodic firmware updates will maintain the effectiveness of these measures and block cartridges that previously worked. Reused HP chips and electronic circuitry enable the use of reused, re manufactured, and refilled cartridges.
body.description: The HP DeskJet 2755e has the essential features you need to print basic color documents like recipes and forms. Print, copy and scan with ease, print from your phone and get easy setup. Includes the optional HP+ Smart Printing System that keeps itself up to date and ready to print from virtually anywhere at any time—at no additional cost.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works with Eero mesh system
reviews.reviewText: TLDR: good printer, works with eero wifi mesh system, set up in less than 10 minutes - great step-by-step instructions via HP Smart app. If you need a basic printer for occasional printing that's super easy to setup, get this. I initially bought the Canon Pixma MG3620. Downloaded their app to get things setup and what a nightmare. I have an eero wifi and the PIXMA printer would not show up on initial scan. I would select scan again after clicking a series of buttons on the printers and then it would popup only to show my wireless network listed 4 times with me being left to determine which one I connected to. I assumed it didn't matter but it did given after selecting 1 and inputting the password, it wouldn't connect. I would click the series of buttons on the printer again to begin the process again only to have all the wifi networks show up (mine + other networks it found) but in a totally different order. This meant I couldn't even weed out each of my 4 networks to find which one was right. Also, the one time I did manage to get it to connect, I had to set my eero wifi in legacy mode for it to connect. As soon as I removed it from legacy mode, the printer began failing again only for me to begin attempting to get it connected again. I looked on many forums but eventually couldn't find a solution as many other people had issues as well.Why do I mention the printer above? Because I then bought THIS hp printer and simply downloaded the app, plugged in the printer, turned it on, and followed the step-by-step instructions (with animations) and it immediately found my network and connected. No duplicate entries, no hassle, it just worked. I was printing within minutes. I then tested printing on my mac, my downstairs PC, and my phone with AirPrint and it all just worked. I spent almost 2 hours on the canon printer troubleshooting and it was just a huge headache. As for print quality between the two, I couldn't tell you, but if you just need a basic occasional printer, you can't beat this for the price and simplicity. Hope this helps.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I changed internet provider and the printer works great.
reviews.reviewText: I can't use it. It will not connect to my computer. I've been on the phone with support numerous times. It still won't print for me. I'd like to return it.Update: I changed internet providers (from T-Mobile to Spectrum and the computer immediately connected and worked great. The printer is doing exactly what I expected and will be wonderful to have. While I was unable to connect it, the HP people who tried to help me connect were great. They were very patient with me, but their efforts did not help until I went back to Spectrum. I hope my negative review will not influence a purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviews.reviewText: For the price this is a decent printer. It took a little thought to set it up. When I set it up in wireless mode it could not find the printer. I had to set it up using USB cable. It prints decent color photos. It is a bit cheaply made, but as I said, for the price $60 it does a good job.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars HP DeskJet 2755e Wireless Color Inkjet-Printer - A Mixed Bag of Pros and Cons for Home Office Setups
reviews.reviewText: My journey with the HP DeskJet 2755e Wireless Color Inkjet-Printer has been an enlightening experience, to say the least. As someone who works from home, a reliable printer is an essential part of my day-to-day activities. While I found several noteworthy features in this model, I can’t overlook some significant drawbacks that have affected my overall satisfaction. This review aims to provide a balanced account of my experiences, helping you make a well-informed decision.🖨️ Easy Installation and User-Friendly Interface: An Idyllic StartFirst impressions are everything, and the HP DeskJet 2755e scored well in this regard. The setup was incredibly straightforward, involving a few quick steps guided by an intuitive mobile application. Within minutes, I was ready to print my first page. The printer interface is equally user-friendly, a godsend for those who might not be too tech-savvy.📱 Mobile Printing: Modern Convenience but Room for ImprovementThe mobile printing feature caught my eye, given how much I rely on cloud services and smartphone apps. While it’s great to have the option to print from your mobile device, I’ve found the function a bit finicky. I’ve often had to restart the app to get it to recognize the printer, which has been a mild annoyance.🖋️ Print Quality: Color Reproduction and Clarity Are On PointWhen it comes to print quality, I have to tip my hat to HP. The color reproduction is vibrant, and text comes out crisp and clear. This feature has been incredibly helpful when printing out color-coded documents or high-resolution photos. However, like any inkjet printer, it does struggle with handling bulk black-and-white text documents at times.🔒 HP+ Subscription: A Double-Edged SwordOne of the things I find controversial about the HP DeskJet 2755e is the HP+ subscription for Instant Ink. On the one hand, it’s convenient not to have to worry about running out of ink. On the other hand, I have reservations about being tied to a subscription model to fully utilize a product I’ve already purchased.⏳ Speed and Efficiency: Where It Lags BehindWhile many of the printer’s features are above par, its speed is notably lacking, especially when compared to some other models in the same price range. A high-quality color print can take up to a minute, which is not ideal when you have multiple pages to print. This is particularly cumbersome when I’m in a rush to print important documents.💡 Wireless Connectivity: A Hit and Miss ScenarioWhile wireless printing is convenient, I found myself wrestling with connectivity issues more often than I would like. The printer has a tendency to lose its Wi-Fi connection, requiring a restart to resolve the problem. Given the competitive market for wireless printers, this is an area where HP could certainly improve.👪 Family-Friendly Features: All Ages Can Use ItOne of the things that can’t be ignored is its family-friendly appeal. With easy-to-use features, even my kids have had an easy time navigating basic functionalities like scanning and copying. This is a plus for families looking to use it for various purposes.💰 Cost-Effectiveness: Could Be BetterIn terms of cost-effectiveness, the printer is a bit of a mixed bag. The initial cost of the machine is reasonable, but the ink cartridges are on the pricier side, especially if you opt-out of the HP+ subscription. It’s crucial to consider the long-term costs involved in maintaining the printer.🛠️ Durability and Build Quality: Middle of the RoadThe build quality is robust but not exceptional. It’s made mostly out of plastic, which is standard for most printers in this range but doesn’t exude a premium feel. However, it has been able to withstand the daily wear and tear typical for a home office setup.🤔 Overall Impressions and Final ThoughtsIn summary, the HP DeskJet 2755e is a printer that does many things well but has distinct areas that need improvement. It offers excellent print quality, family-friendly features, and a convenient setup process. However, its shortcomings in speed, cost-effectiveness, and reliability cannot be ignored. Therefore, I’m giving it a 3-star rating.If you are looking for a basic home office printer that can handle a variety of tasks but are willing to overlook some quirks and are open to a subscription-based ink service, then the HP DeskJet 2755e could be an option worth considering. Thank you for taking the time to read this detailed review; I hope it assists you in making a more informed purchase decision.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It's now over 2 years and going strong.
reviews.reviewText: I use linux as my operating system so I don't have the issues I've read about here. Connecting did take a while due to having to add an app to use this (Windows) software.I make and sell greeting cards and use my printer a lot. I also use the HP ink plan and absolutely love it. I find the quality of my copies are excellent. I print in Hi-def and am not disappointed. The standard printing is fast. If you want good resolution it does take a bit. Yes the cost is low but I've found the features are many and I've had little issues. Mine are due to not using Windows.The only thing I've found that I don't like is no border-less printing. If this one goes belly up, probably get another.
It does the job very well! Easy to install, and so far, it’s working fine when we print via Bluetooth on our phones and computers. We don’t print things a lot, so for us, it’s a good fit.

reviews.reviewTitle: I am absolutely loving my new all-in-one printer made by HP
reviews.reviewText: I do a lot more scanning than I do printing, but when I need to print out my assignments, I can do so now from pretty much anywhere. I haven’t tried printing while I’m at school and the printers here at home but I’m sure there will be a time when I need to. I don’t like paying for paper at school. It’s stupid, I ended up paying half the cost of the printer last time I was in school and I have at least four maybe five more years of schooling to do so this will save me money in the long run The scanner copier works phenomenally not stupid slow like I thought it might be just because it’s flat top scanner but it doesn’t take more than 15 to 20 seconds I am probably gonna have to upgrade to a different printer. Eventually that has a dual sided scanner. I just couldn’t afford one this time. There’s a budget friendly option that is under $200. I would recommend this printer to anybody and everybody. They give you six months subscription to their ink delivery service that will allow you to print out 700 pages per month if you really needed to and when they start billing you for that plan of 700 pages it would cost you 30 bucks I don’t need that much paper so I went with a cheaper plan it cost me like five bucks a month for 50 pages worth of ink and when I’m not using the printer for school, because I’m back at work I can cancel the subscription cancel any time you want and it will finish out the month and won’t bill you for the next month if you don’t End up using your 50 sheets worth of ink. It will roll over to the next month gives you more printing which will allow you to do more printing the next month, which is great when it comes to end of term homework close to end term if you follow few simple requirements. You get a whole bunch of bonus features. There’s nothing I can say about this printer that’s bad thoroughly impressed.

The ap is a bit of a problem. Not to mention it doesn't exactly print from the computer the way a printer should/always has. Can't print any document that isn't a pdf... seriously? Is MS Office, even with simple doc extensions, too much to ask? The Windows ap is full of bugs and unadressed flaws. The ap on my android cell seems to run a bit better.

I hate this printer! I purchased this printer believing it would be convenient and easy to use, I was very wrong. connecting to the internet is difficult, even when right beside the router, tried a corded connection and still only connects once and a while.Ink is suppose to be sent to my home once ink is low or empty, however i used it last in May and still waiting for ink (i have not been charged for it). Purchased some at the store as i desperately need to print some forms and can you believe it is telling me it won’t print until i connect to go instant ink....when you go to the hp app it doesn’t tell me how to re establish the connection. needles to say I am feed up with this thing!needles to say i am beyond sick of this thing!
